intro: Tithymalus nutans, commonly known as the nodding tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that droop downward, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the stems are often hairy. Tithymalus nutans is primarily found in Europe and parts of Asia, where it thrives in temperate climates.
